title: A Multi-Agent AI Framework for Immersive Audiobook Production through Spatial Audio and Neural Narration
author: Arul Selvamani Shaja (Cisco Systems, Inc.), Nia D'Souza Ganapathy (Bombay International School), ...,
relevance_why: The paper presents advanced neural text-to-speech and spatial audio synthesis techniques that align closely with Haohe Liu's work on audio generation and restoration, particularly in terms of creating immersive audio experiences.
background: This paper explores the automation of audiobook production using a multi-agent framework that integrates deep learning models for speech generation and spatial sound design.
contribution: This research introduces a multi-agent AI framework for audiobook production to solve the challenges of immersive storytelling, achieving enhanced audio realism and listener engagement.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional audiobook production involves manual narration and sound design, often leading to high costs and lengthy production times.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon existing methods by automating narration with neural text-to-speech and dynamic spatial audio synthesis, significantly reducing production time and costs.

key_innovation: The unique integration of multiple AI agents specializing in various aspects of audiobook production allows for real-time, immersive audio experiences tailored to narrative content.
real_world_impact: This framework could revolutionize the audiobook industry by making high-quality, immersive audiobooks accessible to a broader audience, including those with visual impairments.
limitations: Limitations regarding computational complexity and scalability in diverse playback environments are acknowledged but not explicitly detailed.

new_terms.higher-order ambisonics: **Higher-order ambisonics** is an advanced spatial audio technique that enables 3D sound field representation and manipulation, allowing for immersive audio experiences.
new_terms.Dynamic Time Warping (DTW): **Dynamic Time Warping** is an algorithm used to align sequences of audio or text that may vary in speed or timing, ensuring synchronization between narration and sound effects.
